item.title: Ecosystem
item.description: The work titled Ecosystem is a networked sound installation inspired by nature. It comprises fictive life-forms communicating by exchanging messages in the form of musical patterns. While the cyber-animals express themselves through sound (or light), the essence of the conversation lies beyond what is humanly conceivable ‚Äî messages are transmitted over a wireless mesh network. The accuracy of the transmission affects the behaviour of the communicating agents, therefore the physicality of the network (comprising dropped or delayed messages) shapes the overall soundscape.

item.title: Structure
item.description: Structure is concieved as an audiovisual performance using generative 3D graphics and spatial sound. Synesthetic audiovisual gestalts are formed by means of micro-relationships of image and sound. The resulting shapes of image and sound are instatiations of an abstract algotithmic structure working in virtual 3D domain - a strictly defined structure creating structures that are seemingly unpredictable. The content itself comes from everyday life - field recordings form the basis of the sound and the 3D point clouds partly contain a model of the buildings of Brno.

item.title: Lithic
item.description: My first multimedia project at Janacek Academy of Performing Arts and my first try at an installation. The subject of the piece are stones, all collected at local former quarry H√°dy. I focused on the sonic and haptic qualities of stones, with a motivation grounded in phenomenology rather than geology. The stones attracted me with their visual purity and universality in meaning. A stone is usually associated with something rigid and stable - I question that with electro-mechanical excitation.
